question: When an altimeter is used for SSR is always referenced to:

choices.choice: QFE
The pressure setting in use

subject: Navigation

question: Mode ‘C’ or mode ‘S’ of SSR is not to be used when indication differ more than

choices.choice: None of the above

subject: Navigation

question: A DME receiver does not lock on to its own transmitter because of:

choices.choice: It works on the principle of random PRF
DME is free from ground clutter.
Transmitter and receiver are working at different frequency.

subject: Navigation

question: No. of a/c required to saturate DME beacon are
subject: Navigation

question: Max no of a/c that can use a DME stn are
subject: Navigation

question: An a/c is flying at a height of 20,000 ft over a DME stn it will show.

choices.choice: Zero.
Appx 6 km

subject: Navigation

question: Ground Speed indications when using a DME will be retiable / accurate when a/c is flying

choices.choice: towards / away from ground stn
a/c is flying 90° to ground stn (max error)
a/c is flying at height less than 1000' per nm

subject: Navigation

question: An a/c DME shows 50 nm, accuracy of indicated distance will be
subject: Navigation

question: A letter Z at the end of identification code means:

choices.choice: DME and VOR are not co-located but serving same stn and at a dist of more than 7 nm
DME and VOR are co-located and are serving same stn.
DME and VOR are not co-located, are serving same stn. are within 7 nm from each other.

subject: Navigation

question: In which situation will speed indications on a airborne Distance Measuring Equipment (DME) most closely represent the groundspeed of an aircraft flying at FL 400?

choices.choice: When overhead the station, with no change of heading at transit
When tracking directly towards the station at a range of 100NM or more
When passing abeam the station and within 5NM of it

subject: Navigation

question: The time taken for the transmission of an interrogation pulse by a Distance Measuring Equipment (DME) to travel to the ground transponder and return to the airborne receiver was 2000micro-second. The slant range from the ground transponder was:

choices.choice: 186NM
296NM
165NM

subject: Navigation

question: What is the maximum distance between VOR and DME / TACAN ground installations if they are to have same morse code identifier?
explanation: The maximum distance between a VOR (Very high frequency Omnidirectional Range) and DME/TACAN (Distance Measuring Equipment/Tactical Air Navigation) ground installations that have the same Morse code identifier is within 2000 feet (approximately 600 meters). If the distance between the two installations is greater than 2000 feet, they cannot share the same identifier.
subject: Navigation

question: A DME in tracking mode subsequently experiences a reduction in signal strength will switch the equipment in the first instance to:

choices.choice: standby mode
memory mode
signal controlled search

subject: Navigation

question: Of what use, if any, is a military TACAN station to civil aviation?

choices.choice: It is of no use to civil aviation
It can provide DME distance
It can provide a magnetic bearing

subject: Navigation

question: A DME that has difficulty obtaining a “lock-on”:(NOTE : PRE = pulse recurrence frequency, PPS = pulse per second)

choices.choice: stays in search mode but reduces PRF to max, 60PPS after 1500 pulse pairs have been transmitted
stays in search mode but without a reduction in PRF
stays in search mode but reduces PRF to max. 60PPS after 100 seconds.

subject: Navigation

question: A VOR and DME are co-located. You want to identify the DME by listening to the Call sign. Having heard the same call sign 4 times in 30 seconds the:

choices.choice: VOR and DME call signs were the same and broadcast with the same pitch
DME call sign was not transmitted, the distance information is sufficient proof of correct operation
DME call sign is the one with the higher pitch that was broadcast only once

subject: Navigation

question: The aircraft DME receiver cannot lock on to interrogation signals reflected from the ground because:

choices.choice: DME pulse recurrent rates are varied
aircraft transmitter and DME ground station are transmitted on different frequencies
reflections are subject to Doppler frequency shift

subject: Navigation

question: Distance Measuring Equipment (DME) operates in the:

choices.choice: UHF band and is a secondary radar system
SHF band and uses frequency modulation techniques
UHF band and is a primary radar system

subject: Navigation

question: The DME (Distance Measuring Equipment) operates within the following frequencles:

choices.choice: 329 to 335MHz
962 to 1213MHz
962 to 1213kHz

subject: Navigation

question: On a DME, display counters rotating throughout their range indicates:

choices.choice: airborne equipment failure
the airborne equipment is conducting a frequency search
the airborne receiver is conducting a range search

subject: Navigation

question: A DME station is located 1000ft above MSL. An aircraft flying at FL 370, 15NM away from the DME station, will have a DME reading of:

choices.choice: 14NM
16NM
15NM

subject: Navigation

question: A DME is located at MSL. AN aircraft passing vertically the station at FL360 will obtain a DME range of approximately:

choices.choice: 6NM
8NM
7NM

subject: Navigation

question: During a flight at FL210, a pilot does not receive any DME distance indication from a DME station located approximately 220NM away. The reason for this that the:

choices.choice: Aero plane is circling around the station
Aero plane is below the "line of sight" altitude
Altitude is too high

subject: Navigation

question: For a conventional DME facility “Beacon Saturation” will occur whenever the number of simultaneous interrogations exceeds:
subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following will give the most accurate calculation of aircraft ground speed?

choices.choice: A DME station sited on the flight route
A VOR station sited on the flight route
A DME station sited across the flight route

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft will not accept replies from its own transmissions that are reflected from the ground because the:

choices.choice: the aircraft's registration is embedded onto the signal.
pulses are transmitted in pairs.
interrogation and reply frequencies are 63 Mhz apart.

subject: Navigation

question: If an ident signal is received once in 30 seconds on a frequency paired VOR/DME, then:

choices.choice: the VOR only is operational.
the TACAN signal is degraded.
the DME only is operational

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft DME receiver rejects pulses meant for other aircraft because:

choices.choice: the random PRF is unique to each aircraft.
the transmission and reply frequencies are 63 MHz apart.
the pulses are unique to each aircraft.

subject: Navigation

question: The DME automatic standby will activate the DME interrogator when:

choices.choice: there are too many aircraft in the area for it to service.
a VOR frequency that has a frequency paired DME is selected.
the DME ident signal is received.

subject: Navigation

question: Airborne DME equipment is able to discriminate between pulses intended for it self and pulses intended for other aircraft because:

choices.choice: aircraft will only accept unique twin pulses.
aircraft reject pulses not synchronised with its own random pulse recurrence rate.
each aircraft has its own frequency allocation.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft flying at flight level 250 wishes to interrogate a DME beacon situated 400 ft above man sea level. What is the maximum range likely to be achieved?
subject: Navigation

question: What is the slant range error for an aircraft flying at 9000 feet absolute altitude above a DME located at elevation 2000 ft, when the slant range is 12 NM?
subject: Navigation

question: The range indicated by DME is considered to be accurate to within:

choices.choice: 3% of range.
1.25 % of range ± 0.25 nm.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft receives a reply pulse from a DME 1200 µ sec after transmission of the interrogation pulse. The DME has a fixed delay of 50 microsec) The range of the aircraft from the DME station is:

choices.choice: 45 nm
75 nm
93 nm

subject: Navigation

question: DME and VOR are frequency paired because:

choices.choice: cockpit workload is reduced.
both ground transmitter aerials can be placed on the same site if required.
the same receiver can be used for both aids.

subject: Navigation

question: A DME receiver is able to distinguish between replies to its own interrogation pulses and those intended for other aircraft using the same transponder because:

choices.choice: DME is a secondary radar and each aircraft transmits and receives on a different frequency.
when DME is in the range search mode it will accept only pluses separated by + or - 63 MHz from the interrogation frequency.
each aircraft transmits pulses at a random rate (jittering) and will only accept replies that match this randomisation.

subject: Navigation

question: Referring to DME during the initial stage of the search pattern before lock-on:

choices.choice: the airborne transmitter transmits 150 pulses each second.
the aircraft transmits 24 pulses per second and the receiver checks a maximum of 150 pulses per second.
the ground receiver maintains the ground transmitter pulse transmission rate at no more than 150 per second.

subject: Navigation

question: DME is a (i) radar operating in the (ii) band and transmits (iii)

choices.choice: (i) secondary; (ii) UHF; (iii) pulse pairs
(i) secondary; (ii) SHF; (iii) 2400 pulse pairs per second
(i) primary; (ii) SHF; (iii) CW pulses

subject: Navigation

question: The accuracy of a DME:

choices.choice: is approximately +-2 nm.
is approximately +-0.5 nm.
decreases with increase of range

subject: Navigation

question: The OFF flag on aircraft DME mileage displays indicate:

choices.choice: any of the below; B or C.
the DME is off.
DME is tuned to the wrong frequency.

subject: Navigation

question: Groundspeed measurement using DME equipment is most accurate flying:

choices.choice: towards the station at short range.
past the station at short range.
from the station at long range.

subject: Navigation

question: A VOR/DME share the same first two letters of their respective identifiers; the last identifying letter of the DME is a Z. This means that;

choices.choice: they are a maximum distance of 30m apart.
they are more than 600m apart but serve the same location.
they are widely separated and do not serve the same location.

subject: Navigation

question: When a DME is used insted of marker beacons to provide range to the threshold on an ILS approach and where the DME frequency is paired with the ILS, the DME indications should not be used at altitudes greater than:
subject: Navigation

question: If a VOR station and a DME station, having different locations, are selected to provide a fix:

choices.choice: all 2 answers below are correct.
two different IDs will have to be checked
two sets, with separate frequency control, are required in the aircraft.

subject: Navigation

question: The airborne DME equipment will transmit pulse pairs at a comparatively high PRF:

choices.choice: At all times, except when the panel control LO is operated.
When first switched on and after a channel selection
Whenever a stable signal is being received from the selected ground station

subject: Navigation
